> Do you know why is this not caught by the tests?

Because the convention for (compute) driver method tests in libcloud never checks what data is actually being sent, but only if the response that would be returned from the api (according to the test fixture) returns an object with the expected properties. For example, see the test for `ex_create_image_member` [here](https://github.com/apache/libcloud/blob/4d0f9e0a66245756594aa6c5e40dacc5e2f78209/libcloud/test/compute/test_openstack.py#L1653). This pattern exists in most of the driver method tests.

I think `ex_update_image` is actually OK this way and there is just an inconsistency in the OpenStack API, I think I tested that specific method manually [in this earlier PR](https://github.com/apache/libcloud/pull/1151):

> I don't understand the logic in _get_instance_vhd(). Why does it try to remove the VHD in the while loop?

As far as i understand. When you spin up new VM, OS drive is saved as VHD file, but when you destroy it, it won't delete it, so you need to make sure that file doesn't exists in case you wanna do create machine A -> destroy machine A -> create machine A, cause you wouldn't get a fresh drive. The loop i don't understand as well.

> Is the 'image' param in create_node() the source or the destination VHD? If it's the source VHD, how do I specify the target VHD?

`image` param is the source VHD to from you wanna boot. You wont specify a target VHD, it get's generated for you from the storage account and blob container parameters.

To the error actually you getting i would expect you got wrong storage account or blob container, do you have them created ? `ex_storage_account` and `ex_blob_container` which is default `vhds`
